Sentence: Their names are Sixo, Paul D, Paul A, Paul F, and Halle
Sethe chooses to marry Halle, apparently in part because he (Paul) has proven generous enough to buy his (Paul) mother's freedom by hiring himself out on the weekends
Afterward, Halle goes mad: Paul D sees him (D) sitting by a churn with butter slathered all over his (D) face
